name: py-pymongo

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
The PyMongo distribution contains tools for interacting with MongoDB
database from Python. The bson package is an implementation of the BSON
format for Python. The pymongo package is a native Python driver for
MongoDB. The gridfs package is a gridfs implementation on top of
pymongo. PyMongo supports MongoDB 2.6, 3.0, 3.2, 3.4, 3.6, 4.0 and 4.2.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependent_to.name: mongodb
dependent_to.description:
MongoDB is a source-available cross-platform document-oriented database
program. Classified as a NoSQL database program, MongoDB uses JSON-like
documents with optional schemas.

dependent_to.name: py-matminer
dependent_to.description:
Matminer is a library for performing data mining in the field of
materials science.

dependent_to.name: py-radical-pilot
dependent_to.description:
RADICAL-Pilot is a Pilot system specialized in executing applications
composed of many computational tasks on high performance computing (HPC)
platforms.

dependent_to.name: py-hyperopt
dependent_to.description:
Hyperopt is a Python library for serial and parallel optimization over
awkward search spaces, which may include real-valued, discrete, and
conditional dimensions.

dependent_to.name: py-fireworks
dependent_to.description: FireWorks stores, executes, and manages calculation workflows.

dependent_to.name: py-apache-beam
dependent_to.description: Apache Beam is a unified programming model for Batch and Streaming.

dependent_to.name: py-radical-utils
dependent_to.description:
RADICAL-Utils contains shared code and tools for various RADICAL-
Cybertools packages.

dependent_to.name: py-motor
dependent_to.description: async Python driver for MongoDB and Tornado or asyncio
